alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 11:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River from Bedford to Shoals. White River from Elliston to Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale. White River at Edwardsport. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the White River at Elliston to all points downstream...and along the East Fork White River from near Bedford to all points downstream. Moderate flooding has begun at Petersburg...and will continue along the lower White River through Sunday. The crest on the White River will continue along the Knox...Daviess County line through Friday. Flooding will likely last through Friday along Greene County portions of the White River...and through next week along lower portions of the White River. The crest on the East Fork White River will pass Bedford later today with minor flooding continuing for areas downstream through early next week. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.3 feet, During April 2013 when Petersburg reached this level, the water only reached the white line of SR 257 south of Washington, but never closed the road. Shoals only went to 11.67 feet during April 2013. This is the first that locals can remember such a high stage for Petersburg and SR 257 remaining open. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday /9:30 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 23.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Thursday /9:30 AM CDT Thursday/ was 23.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.1 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
